title: K-12 Emergency Remote Teaching (ERT) Project-Based Social and Civic Curriculum for Transitioning to Elementary Online Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational methodologies and experience with online learning tools, comprehension of elementary social studies curricula, foundational knowledge of community resource utilization, and basic understanding of citizenship and collaborative problem-solving
context.additional_context: A training program designed to implement project-based learning in smartphone-centric, resource-limited environments, based on elementary education experiences during COVID-19. It focuses on developing educational strategies that consider local cultural/institutional contexts and civic literacy, aiming to cultivate learners' social responsibility and community awareness.

learning_goals: Learners will develop the ability to apply the CIPP framework for transitioning to elementary online learning during emergencies like COVID-19 within a socio-civic educational context, while strengthening collaborative problem-solving skills through community network analysis.

Learners will successfully design smartphone-based project learning in low-technology-access environments with at least 80% success, establishing citizen engagement strategies based on digital citizenship and collaborative decision-making competencies.

Learners will apply and evaluate ERT strategies developed via PBL over four weeks to real elementary education scenarios, incorporating relationship-building approaches and civic education linkage strategies that reflect the local communityâ€™s cultural and institutional contexts.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
